author: jimmygchen
content:
We've got an image for `peerdas-devnet-4`: `sigmaprime/lighthouse:sigp-pr-6828-7e397c0`

Branch here: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/6828

I've tried running a local devnet with Prysm but the network split on the first Fulu slot - we got a state root mismatch when processing the first Fulu block from Prysm. I've looked at the SSZ of the states but haven't found the root cause of why they don't match. Will investigate further tomorrow.

author: manunlp
content: That's quite strange because the state and beacon block do not change between electra and fulu.

author: agnxsh
content:
Update from Nimbus — we’re having issues with column sync, unfortunately due to which the BN is crashing, recently our sync strategy was changed and it didn’t include columns as we were making it solely for pectra.

Hopefully things should be fixed in the next 2-3 days.

author: agnxsh
content: If there was an option to have the new sync as optional I would’ve tried to interop with Prysm atleast, but it isn’t. So a couple more days, to get things totally working from our side

author: manunlp
content: By any chance do you have a screenshot of dora?

author: manunlp
content: It helps to see what is wrong

author: parithosh
content: and eventually I guess no one is able to agree on a fork and chain dies

author: manunlp
content:
Here, the slot 25920 is voluntary ignored by `4-geth-prysm` because of the `--data-columns-ignore-slot-multiple=20` option. (`25920%20 == 0`)
This node orphans some blocks, but eventually gets back on track at slot 25937. So I would say nothing wrong with this node on this screenshot.

author: manunlp
content: But however `1-geth-prysm` has two missed slots 25934 and 25936, which is not good.
